headline: Growth and Integrated Demand Marketing
summary: I am a goal-oriented, self-motivator with high attention to detail and ensuring high standards in all functions of B2B marketing. With 18+ years in progressively responsible Marketing roles, my core competencies include: - strategy and execution of end-to-end global integrated demand generation campaigns (messaging, content generation, digital asset development, online/offline events, paid media, organic social media, direct mailers, sales lead development, marketing operations) localized for our global market - establishing and analyzing metrics to prove ROI - managing large-scale, high-profile events and other field activities - digital marketing (social media, advertising and website maintenance) - creating and growing various functions of marketing As an extension of the sales team, I aim to provide them with high-quality leads and opportunities to shorten sales cycles, decrease cost of acquisition and increase revenue. View my portfolio of major global integrated marketing campaigns here: https://krissy-camacho.format.com/
organization_description_1: - Lead multiple departments driving brand awareness and demand within the North American market including field marketing, ABM, and integrated campaigns - Fastly Global Motorsport sponsorship and brand experience lead of the Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS Formula One Team partnership
organization_title_2: Director, Demand Gen, Head of Global Integrated Campaigns
organization_description_2: - Built + scaled globally a new marketing function for Integrated Campaigns (including development of KPIs, campaign framework, planning tools, global localization plan, and overall budget management). Generated over 46,000 leads (65% net new) and influenced over 70M in pipeline in inaugural year. - Launched inaugural campaign while building the new department and drove over 5M net new qualified pipeline in the first 3 months. My core responsibilities included end-to-end campaign strategy and execution, messaging and content creation, imagery/theme development, paid media strategy, optimization, and reporting. - Upon acquisition of Endgame, I led the development of a new solution marketing strategy and framework for Elastic Security including crafting messaging/positioning, defining buyer personas, developing new content, defining proper mix of digital demand generation programs/channels and field events with primary KPI to generate qualified pipeline opportunities for sales
organization_title_3: Director, Head of Demand Generation & Marketing Operations (acquired by Elastic)
organization_description_3: - Key contribution: generated 50% of sales opportunity pipeline, exceeding quota by 30% - Direct all aspects of demand generation and marketing operations including: - Global Field Marketing and Events - Global Partner/Channel Marketing and Events - Sales Account Development - Digital Marketing: social media, advertising, marketing automation/email campaigns, website content/maintenance, SEO, SEM - Brand and visual identity - Content marketing: help convert prospective customers at all points in the funnel  - Manage team of SDRs, Field Marketers, Digital Marketers, and Graphic Designers - Develop and scale all inbound, outbound and ABM strategies - Manage entire marketing team budget - Advanced proficiency in: Marketo, Salesforce, DiscoverOrg, Demandbase, Outreach, DialSource, Hootsuite, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Email On Acid, Microsoft Office programs, Photoshop, InDesign, adobe Illustrator, Google AdWords, Moz, Google Anaytics, Drupal, HTML, CSS - Owned the global marketing-sourced sales pipeline number, strategy and execution on all demand generation activities, and overarching GTM plan (including TAM analysis, buyer’s journey, and content mapping) - Forecasted, measured and analyzed impact of programs on sales cycles, revenue and reported outcomes through weekly and monthly metrics dashboards - Evaluated, purchased, and onboarded new marketing tools and sales prospecting platforms - Major accomplishments include: -      Exceeded primary KPI of generating 20%+ qualified sales pipeline from marketing programs (53% generated) -      Launched company’s first ever multi-channel advertising initiative, generating millions of dollars in pipeline -      Rebuilt Endgame.com for SEO, brand consistency, and to improve demo request conversion rates -      Rebuilt lead scoring model to ensure higher quality MQLs/SQLs were distributed to sales reps
organization_title_4: Head of North American Field Marketing, Digital Marketing and Sales Development
organization_description_4: - Lead all account based marketing strategic efforts including identifying target accounts and channels/initiatives used to convert accounts - Lead strategy and execution on all demand generation activities including field marketing (direct and channel), sales development, marketing operations, advertising and social media - Outlined then implemented annual demand generation and integrated marketing plan (events/webinars, social media, advertising, sales lead development) while remaining closely aligned with sales team to support their revenue goals - Created and executed targeted (sometimes regional) marketing campaigns to create new opportunities for sales, drive pipeline acceleration and increase brand awareness for technology start-up -	Forecasted, measured and analyzed impact of programs on sales cycles, revenue and reported outcomes through weekly and monthly metrics dashboards - Responsible for full lifecycle of all marketing programs, from strategy/planning, execution and continuously monitoring and reporting ROI to improve programs - Leverage multiple tools for success including Salesforce, Marketo, DiscoverOrg, DialSource and social media - Directly managed, motivated and developed sales development representative and provided robust pipeline of marketing qualified leads for SDR appointment setting - Manage annual budget for entire marketing team - Major accomplishments:       - Primary KPI: Met or exceeded pipeline contribution goals across 24 months       - Reduced average cost per lead by over $250 within one quarter       - Doubled total number of followers across all social media channels in 1 year (organic growth only)       - More than doubled MQL to SQL conversion rate within one quarter and reduced average time for conversion by 60%
organization_title_5: Head of Security Field Marketing/Demand Generation
organization_description_5: - Acting demand generation lead and social media manager for security services - Conceptualized, pitched then executed concept for year-long, multi-city lead generation/custom appreciation event series promoting Neustar Security Services to targeted audience. Campaign drove tens of thousands of brand impressions, generated new sales opportunities, drove business impact across the US and doubled expected attendance -	Governed highly visible portfolio of events with annual operating plan of over 600K for Neustar Security Services. Developed methods for ROI/KPI and influence revenue tracking then executed unique, impactful attendee experiences -	Constructed first event marketing plan for Neustar Security Operations Center then planned unique, customized events for visiting customers and prospects, contributing to over 110K influence revenue in Q1 -	Initiated new demand/lead generation efforts for exclusive, curated events (sales kickoff, annual awards, user conferences), special events and trade shows. Doubled expected event attendance and enhanced brand impressions by creating complex, targeted, grassroots social media campaigns across multiple channels -	Built customized event websites (HTML), designed and built mobile apps, created impactful invitations, managed registration process then communicated with attendees pre, during and post-event -	Influenced event stakeholders, led core planning meetings, drove requirements and executed events from conception through completion -	Solid project management of event planning timelines, large budgets and cross-functional teams including product marketing, sales, and marketing
organization_title_6: Strategic Field Marketing (spun off from SAIC)
organization_description_6: - Saved, on average, 240K of events budget each year through strategic planning and execution -	Governed multiple trade show programs (2.M+ AOP; national security & healthcare; domestic and international) post company split from SAIC to include strategic planning, estimating/managing yearly budgets, large-scale event management, creating advertisements, vendor negotiation and social media messaging for 300+ meetings & events per year -	Reinforced new company brand by designing corporate trade show booth properties; saved 250K in one year through multiple uses of properties and decreased storage costs -	Fundraised over 100K for one charitable organization by leading multiple grassroots, community outreach and corporate social responsibility activities -	Key contributor in activating new company brand by assisting in development of brand guidelines and visual identity for Leidos pre & post company split
organization_description_7: -	Cultivated large government contractor’s company-wide social media program; increased impressions and engagement across multiple channels -	Governed multiple trade show programs (2.M+ AOP; national security & healthcare; domestic and international) to include strategic planning, estimating/managing yearly budgets, large-scale event management, creating advertisements, vendor negotiation and social media messaging for 300+ meetings & events per year -	Reinforced new company brand by designing corporate trade show booth properties; saved 250K in one year through multiple uses of properties and decreased storage costs -	Fundraised over 100K for one charitable organization by leading multiple grassroots, community outreach and corporate social responsibility activities -	Envisioned then implemented event transition tasks under tight deadlines pre-company split between SAIC and Leidos. Assisted corporate office in change management by separating budgets, off-site storage, booth properties and writing new policies for Leidos.  -	Key contributor in activating new company brand by assisting in development of brand guidelines and visual identity for Leidos pre & post company split
organization_description_8: -	Managed trade show development from kickoff to on-site coordination averaging 25 shows of various sizes per year; planned special events such as golf tournament and receptions (25-300 attendees) for 150+ events per year -	Led multi-stakeholder planning meetings with employees and vendors, managed RPFs, negotiated contracts, managed hotel blocks, BEOs and registration websites and booked speakers
organization_description_9: -	Increased corporate technology demonstration center usage by 15% YOY by creating collateral and working with sales to utilize the center
organization_description_10: -	As PM, tripled original contract value with government client through increased task orders -	Hired then managed 3-4 technical staff and temporary employees -	Gained a new government client, contributing to company revenue -	Planned and executed company events while working under tight budgets and timelines
education_description_2: - Elected President of Junior Achievement Program then developed mock company, business strategy and communication and marketing plan; created concept then directed an original commercial to market new product to student body; donated funds raised to charity - Honor Roll in 75% of semesters - Student Government Association and photography concentration
